messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Strategy Games
messages.msgSnippet: Yu-Gi-Oh is hugely strategic!   So much that I can t even wrap my brain around it.  It has such variations going on all the time that it is soooo
messages.messageBody:
Yu-Gi-Oh is hugely strategic! So much that I can't even wrap my brain
around it. It has such variations going on all the time that it is soooo
challenging--different cards being drawn all the time so the scenerio is
always changing.

When I was growing up, I played Stratego, that's about all I can handle,
<g> set the stage and deal with it. With Yu-Gi-Oh, the stage is
constantly changing. Tons of thinking going on to play that game.

Kelli~ mom and wife to Yu-Gi-Oh players :)


----- Original Message -----
From: "Andrea" <andrea@...>
To: <UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 23, 2003 5:51 AM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Strategy Games, was Re: Radical vs.
Regular?


> At 05:55 PM 12/22/03 -0800, Pam wrote:
> >I love games. But I get bored with board games like Monopoly or Life -
> >roll and move, roll and move. I like strategy games. <snip.
>
> Pam, what are your favourite strategy games? My older sons (ages 11 and 8)
> don't like the roll and move games much but William (11) said he played
> Risk and liked it. We have played Junior Labyrinth many many times.
>
> Donna Andrea
>
